CatDescriptText: Kathleen Hutson, housewife, North Side was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 17, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe that an accused person, scheduled for an appearance before a jury, is actually judged by a "jury of his peers" (laborers, housewives, rich, poor, Catholic, Jew of Protestant, Negro and white, Northerner, Southerner, Easterner or Westerner, etc.) or is the jury more or less handpicked to satisfy the whims of the prosecution and defense lawyers?" Answer reads: "I don't know, because I've never been in court.  From what I have read, most verdicts are fair."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Kathleen Hutson wearing striped coat with solid color collar, standing in front of flecked stone wall
